accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Stanford University Center for African Studies Records (SC0832). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: The Center for African Studies is an interdisciplinary program for undergraduate and graduate students. CAS at Stanford coordinates with UC Berkeley to form the Stanford/Berkeley Joint Center for African Studies. Through this arrangement courses from each institution are incorporated into one program.

Although there is not an African Studies major at Stanford, the Center for African Studies seeks to specifically acknowledge Stanford students who choose to take our courses, which cover a wide, interdisciplinary range of topics relating to Africa. Both the minor in African Studies and the certificate in African Studies are interdisciplinary programs that allow the participating student the opportunity to select relevant courses in various departments according to his or her interests.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Grants files include proposals, budgets, reports, correspondence, memoranda, enrollment statistics, information gathered, and other items.
Conference files include correspondence, notes, programs, brochures, conference papers, and other materials; there are some photographs from the 1993 conference.
